title: John Bercow will go up in flames when bonfire society set fire to his 36ft-high effigy
text:
A giant effigy of John Bercow is set to light up the skies on Guys Fawkes night at the hands of Britain's most infamous bonfire society.

The 36ft-high replica of the Commons Speaker, which shows him holding the heads of both Boris Johnson and Jeremy Corbyn, will go up in flames on Saturday night.

Edenbridge's Bonfire Society in Kent has a long history of burning effigies of celebrities and politicians alike.

It made headlines around the world after setting alight to a giant Donald Trump, while other targets have included Harvey Weinstein and Wayne Rooney.

Mr Bercow was chosen for this year's effigy after his animated attempts to keep order in Britain's Parliament, organisers revealed.

Andrea Deans, who created the likeness: 'As always, we received many suggestions for who the public would like to see at our event and this year it was a close vote between John Bercow and Piers Morgan.

'However John Bercow is not going to be on his own on the night as we have included Johnson, Corbyn and the whole Houses of Parliament to join him.'

The society revealed that preparations took a backwards step this week after Mr Bercow's head blew off during high winds.

It is expected that the society will take the structure inside until Saturday, and will undertake serious repair works to fix the headless Guy.

Edenbridge Bonfire Society Chairman, Bill Cummings, said: 'Our message to Mr Bercow is that you cannot keep disrupting Parliament and this is one situation you cannot argue yourself out of!

'We hope Mr Bercow will appreciate the humour contained in our caricature and take it in the good spirit with which it is intended.'

The Kent town will see more than 750 people participating in the torchlit parade through Edenbridge High Street.

Last year's event raised £7,000 for a variety of local charities and community organisations.
